title: Drawing, "Richard H. Mandel House: Sideboard, Lacquered", November 13, 1934
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8036/F.S./MANDEL/POL. CHROM PULL/REFLECTOR/ALL LACQUERED/IN TWO TONES/WHITE HOLLY/INTERIORS, Olsson/11/13/34, 11/16/34, 1, S.H.K.; in graphite at left of stamp: SIDEBOARD ALL LACQUERED IN TWO TONES/WHITE HOLLY INTERIORS-/POL. CHROM. PULLS/3 DRAWERS ON EXT. SLIDES-/TOP DRAWER WITH SUBDIVISIONS/& TRAYS FOR SILVERWARE/VELVET LINED-/3 SLIDING SHELVES BEHIND DOORS-/REFLECTOR IN RAISED PART OF/TOP-SWITCH-FLEXIBLE WIRE/& PLUG.-VENTILATION IN REAR; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawing for sideboard. Raised left side with reflector on top surface. Three long horizontal drawers, off-center towards right with long horizontal polished chrome pulls. Subdivisions and trays in top drawer for silverware, with velvet lining. Cabinet door at far right, curved exterior; three sliding shelves inside. Cabinet in two shades of lacquer.
